title: D-Media: Decentralized Social Media
description: A project I worked on during the Decrypt Tokyo Blockchain hackathon. Prototyped and pitched a decentralized peer-reviewed social media platform similar to Twitter, built with Vue JS, MongoDB, and a sidechain for the Ethereum blockchain, Ubiqys Kit. Won the Social Good award.

title: Vue Lunch App
description: Simple app that lets you post your plans for lunch to get others to join you, made in 2~3 days to learn Vue JS, express, and MongoDB, for my internship at Plaid.

title: Bike Pittsburgh Data Science Project
description: A project with Students Using Data for Social Good, an organization that is a part of the Heinz College. Worked on a team of graduate students as a freshmen, doing data cleaning with R, as well as using GeoPandas and ArcGIS Online to create data visualizations using geolocation to gain insight into the OpenStreetsPGH event attendees and help reach a more diverse audience

title: Numberpedia
description: My first JS project that I coded for fun in a day during a weekend. Used anime.js to do some fun animations and tried to find fun facts about numbers to share!
